dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6657 IH: Securing Strictly Needy Americans’ Pivotal (SNAP) Benefits Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rouzer (for himself and Mr. Bacon) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, to limit the conditions applicable to the use of electronic benefit transfer (EBT) cards to purchase food, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Securing Strictly Needy Americans’ Pivotal (SNAP) Benefits Act of 2023.
Section 501 of title IV of division HH of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The State agency shall suspend the accounts of households for which EBT card transactions are made exclusively out-of-State for a period longer than 60 days, until—

paragraph.text: the household affirmatively provides substantiating evidence that the members of the household who are program participants still reside in the state from which they receive benefits; or
an investigation is conducted and conclusively determines that the members of the household who are program participants still reside in the state from which they receive benefits.

section.header: Limitation on redemption of supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits by owners of approved retail food stores and wholesale food concerns
section.text: Section 9 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2020) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Limitation on redemption of supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits by households that include members who are owners of approved retail food stores or wholesale food concerns

paragraph.text: A household that includes a member who is an owner of an approved retail food store or wholesale food concern may not redeem supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits at such store or such concern.
Paragraph (1) shall not apply with respect to a retail food store, or a wholesale food concert, that is owned by a publicly owned corporation or by a government.

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
